text: A fancy party is in progress. The butler, a large man nam some punch from a bowl into a glass as THE COUNTESS, a sn long cigarette holder and a monocle, looks on.
Isn't it rather odd that your mistress hasn't  put in an appearance at her own party?
(hands her the punch)

Uh, yes, Madame. I'm sorry, Madame. The Countess walks off with disdain. The butler shoots a room. We follow his gaze with a FAST PAN TO the man of th a rather mousy gentlemen who sits worriedly in a chair. H stands over him, smoking a cigar.
(to himself)
Where is she?  Rumsford pounds his fist into his hand and rises abruptly
Where is that wife of mine?
Now, take it easy, Rumsford. Williams arrives with a tray of drinks.
A drink, sir? Rumsford and York each take a drink.
(to Williams)
Any word from Mrs. Rumsford?
Not a word, sir. I'm terribly upset.
You're upset.  What about me? She invites all  these people to her birthday party and then  runs out on them!
She always does that, sir.  She'll probably be  back in a day or two.
(chokes on his drink)
Day or two?! Williams makes a face and walks off.
Snap out of it, Rumsford. You must make  allowances for her youth. Sherry'll turn up.

If I didn't love that woman so much, I swear  I'd-- A car horn HONKS. Rumsford and York stare in horror as an into the living room and SCREECHES to a halt in front of guests GASP in amazement. At the wheel of the car is the and vivacious SHERRY RUMSFORD, wearing a hat and a fur co husband and starts to climb out of the car.
Oh, darling!  Hello!  Be right over!  Williams enters and stares in shock at the car. SHERRY (o.s.)
Oh, Williams! Williams regains his composure and stands at attention. WILLIAMS (with some resignation)

Ready, Madame. Sherry takes off her fur coat while Rumsford and York exc She throws her fur coat across the room at Williams and i drapes itself goofily around his shoulders. She takes off it onto Williams' head. He looks rather ridiculous in a l but bears the humiliation with dignity. Meanwhile, Rumsfo RUMSFORD
Listen, York. You're a doctor and you're my  best friend. Isn't there anything you can do  for her? DR. YORK
I'm afraid she's a bit out of my line. The men  you want are Doctors Ziller, Zeller, and  Zoller. RUMSFORD
Do you think they can help her? DR. YORK
Well, they're the finest psychiatrists in the  business. They're terribly expensive and their  methods are very peculiar. But they do get  results. RUMSFORD
I'll have Williams call them. I'll have  Williams call them immediately. Rumsford rings for the butler. York checks his watch. DR. YORK
I've got to see a patient, Rummy. I'll try to  get back later. Good luck. RUMSFORD
Thanks. York exits as Williams approaches. RUMSFORD
Oh, Williams. I want you to telephone Doctors  Ziller, Zeller, and Zoller.
Painted onto the glass of the office's front door, a sign Dr. Z. ZILLER, M.D. Dr. X. ZELLER, M.D. Dr. Y. ZOLLER, M.D.
We PAN from the door to reveal a PAINTER cleaning up his cans, brushes, etc.) and a SECRETARY who struggles with a telephone switchboard. SECRETARY (upset)
Oh, this switchboard! The secretary holds the headphone to her ear as she tries SECRETARY
Oh, it's dead! Frustrated, she throws the headphone down and turns to th SECRETARY
Thank goodness you're through. I've been almost  crazy. PAINTER

Yes, ma'am. I'll have my stuff out right after  lunch. The secretary exits into a private office as the painter door. Immediately, the Three Stooges enter from the front CURLY. Moe carries a tool box. Curly carries a huge ladde LARRY
Looks like there's nobody here. MOE
This is the place all right. CURLY
Maybe I got the-- Curly turns to look around and SMASHES the glass of the f ladder. LARRY
You puddin'-head!  Why don't you look what  you're doin'? CURLY
I couldn't help it. I was lookin' around to see  if there's anybody in the office and when I  turned-- Curly turns and SMASHES a glass water cooler with the lad MOE
Look what you did! CURLY
What?! Curly turns to look at the smashed water cooler and the l and POPS Moe in the face. MOE
Oh! Moe clutches his eye in pain. He advances on Curly. MOE
Why don't you be careful? Moe pokes Curly in the eye. LARRY
Drop that ladder before you hurt somebody. Curly DROPS the ladder on Moe's foot. Moe clutches his fo MOE
Remind me to tear out your Adam's apple. CURLY
I'll make a note of it. As Curly reaches into his pocket, the secretary returns a they've made. Curly, with a tiny pencil and pad, makes a remind Moe to tear out his Adam's apple. MOE (annoyed)
Give me that! Moe grabs the pencil away from Curly. Curly squeals and p from his pocket and starts to write with it. Moe grabs th MOE
What's the matter with you? Curly makes a few noises of frustration and then pulls a from his jacket and starts to write. CURLY
Nyuk nyuk nyuk nyuk. Moe grabs the pencil and HITS Curly over the head with it CURLY
Oh! You'll break my pencil! MOE
I'll break your head. Moe pulls a hair out of Curly's chest and Curly squeals i secretary joins them. SECRETARY
Say, what war is this? MOE
Never mind the wisecracks, Toots. We're  trouble-shooters from the phone company. What's  wrong here? SECRETARY
Painters ruined my switchboard. MOE
Come on. The Stooges move to the switchboard. SECRETARY
If you can bring it to life and a call comes in  for the doctors, say they're out of town. I'm  goin' to lunch. MOE
Okay. As the secretary exits, Curly calls after her. CURLY
Hey! Bring me back a piece of burnt toast and a  rotten egg! LARRY
Burnt toast and a rotten egg? CURLY
Yeah, I got a tapeworm and that's good enough  for 'im. MOE (pushes Curly)
Go on!  Get busy! The Stooges get to work. Curly sees a stethoscope in a do switchboard. He pulls it out and puts the earpieces in hi MOE (to Larry)
How's she comin'? LARRY
Not so good. Curly puts the stethoscope against the switchboard. CURLY (to the switchboard)
Say, "Ahh!" MOE (to Curly, off the stethoscope)
What do you got here? Moe pulls on the stethoscope, stretching it out. CURLY
Hey, gimme that! Gimme that!   Moe releases the stethoscope -- it snaps back and WHACKS CURLY
Ohhh! Moe violently pulls the earpieces from Curly's ears, caus Curly GNASHES his teeth pneumatically at Moe who hands th to him. MOE
Now, go on! Get busy like I told ya!  (to Larry)
Go on! Moe shoos Larry away from the board, sits, and puts on th puts a phone wire up to a hole in the board. MOE

Pull this line through and hook it on number  six. Curly pulls the line through the hole in the board -- but attached to the headphones on Moe's head, thus causing Mo pulled forward violently. Moe's head SMASHES into the boa MOE

Oh! Moe pulls his head back, drawing the wire backwards. This who squeals and pulls on it again -- too hard. He stumble of the scene.  There is a huge CRASH.  Moe and Larry jump QUICKLY TO Curly sitting in a bucket amidst the painter's his hands stuck in a paint can and a wooden plank on his CURLY
Woo-woo. Woo-hoo-hoo. Hey, Larry!  Help me!   I'm surrounded! Woo-hoo-hoo! Moe and Larry rush to Curly's aid. They push the plank aw grabbing an arm, lift Curly to his feet. MOE
Get up.  (to Larry, off the bucket wedged onto Curly's rear)
Get a hold o' that! Moe grabs Curly by the head and Larry pulls the bucket of Larry FALLS to the floor in the process.
Williams is on the phone, making a call. WILLIAMS (into the phone)
Hello?  (beat)
Yes, I know it's out of order. I've been trying  for half an hour to get it.
The Stooges stand together and confer. MOE (to Curly)
What's the matter with you, puddin'-head? You  been actin' slug-nutty all day. CURLY
It's Gertie. She's gonna have-- Curly grows suddenly bashful.  But Moe realizes what he m MOE
That's wonderful. When do you expect it? CURLY
Any minute. That's why I'm so upset. MOE
No foolin'? Why didn't you tell us? CURLY
But, you see, I-- LARRY
I know. You're broke. CURLY (nods)
Flat as a floogie. MOE
That's bad. We gotta figure out a way to get  some money and get it quick. CURLY
Aw, thanks, Moe. MOE
You're welcome. Moe and Curly shake hands. CURLY
Okay, I got-- Moe looks down in disgust at his hand, now stained with p Moe wipes his hand on Curly's jacket. MOE
Come on. Curly barks like a dog. Moe CONKS Curly in the back of th MOE
Come on! Get to work! The Stooges head back to the switchboard.
Williams is still on the phone. WILLIAMS
Now, Operator, you must get that number. Now,  try again, please.
Larry struggles with some phone wires.  Frustrated, he wh LARRY (disgusted)
Ahhh... Miraculously, the wire lodges in the proper hole: a light board starts to BUZZ. The Stooges rush to the board and M MOE
Hello, Operator?
WILLIAMS
Is this Susquehanna two-two-two-two?
MOE (into the phone)
Toot-toot-toot-toot? What do you think you're  doin' -- playin' trains? CURLY
Ooooh! I love to play trains!   (imitates a train)
Choo choo choo choo choo! Whooo-woo! Sssssssh! MOE (to Curly)
Why don't you get a toupee with some brains in  it? Moe THWACKS Curly's nose. Curly pulls up Moe's bangs and forehead. MOE (to Curly)
Why, you--! Moe turns his attention to the phone.
WILLIAMS
I want to speak to Doctor Ziller, Zeller, or  Zoller. This is an important case. We'll pay  any price if they'll come over immediately.  Money is no object.
MOE (into the phone)
We'll be there in a flash in the flesh! Moe hangs up and addresses Larry and Curly. MOE
We need money and I got a way to get it. LARRY
What are we supposed to do? MOE (points to Curly)
You're Ziller.  (points to Larry)
You're Zeller.  (grandly)
And I'm Doctor Zoller. CURLY (shakes Moe's hand)
Oh, glad to meetcha, Doctor. MOE
How are ya, son? CURLY
Now, listen, Doc. I'm troubled with T.S. MOE
What do you mean, T.S.? CURLY
Two Stomachs! MOE
Stick out yer tongue! Curly sticks out his tongue. Moe PUNCHES him in one of hi MOE
There's an impatient patient waiting. Come on. Although they protest, Moe grabs Curly by the ear and Lar drags them away.
Sherry comes running out of the building, followed by Rum A chauffeur waits beside a fancy car (license number 5R 1 RUMSFORD
Wait! Sherry, you can't run out on your guests  like this again. SHERRY
But, darling, I'm bored! I'm only going for a  short ride in a submarine! I'll be back in a  day or two. Tell them all to wait. RUMSFORD

But, Sh-- They are interrupted by the gentle RINGING of bicycle bel dressed in top hats and tails -- come riding up on a thre They fall off the bike at the edge of the driveway -- to confusion of the Rumsfords. The Stooges rise and rush ove RUMSFORD
Gentlemen, I'm Mr. Rumsford. Are you looking  for someone? CURLY
I'm Ziller. LARRY
I'm Zeller. MOE
I'm Zoller. As Sherry looks on with interest, Moe puts a shoe horn ne MOE
Stick out yer tongue. Rumsford opens his mouth and Moe uses the shoe horn as a MOE
Say, "Ahh" with your mouth closed. RUMSFORD
Ahhh. LARRY (singing in harmony)
Ahhh. MOE & CURLY (joining in)
Ahhh. ALL THREE STOOGES (singing)
Ahhh...  (spoken, with disgust)
Rats! MOE
This is serious. CURLY
You're wrong, gentlemen. It's strictly a case  of latkes and [pippiks?] Sherry roars with laughter at the Stooges. SHERRY (practically squealing)
This is priceless. RUMSFORD (to the Stooges)
I'm not the patient. It's Mrs. Rumsford. The chauffeur looks on with amazement as the Stooges turn CURLY
Oh. How do you do, Madame? RUMSFORD
Now, see here, Sherry... SHERRY

Oh, darling, you take the submarine ride. I  wouldn't leave these men on a bet. Come,  gentlemen! The last one in is a Republican! Sherry suddenly bolts for the front door.  The Stooges ta pursuit, with Curly circling Rumsford like an airplane be after her.  A stunned Rumsford quickly follows.

Sherry runs in, followed closely by the Stooges. Moe plow upsetting the tray of pretzels he carries and knocking hi Sherry laughs gaily throughout.  After a moment, there is woman's SHRIEK. Sherry and the Stooges turn to look at th Williams now lies in the Countess' lap beside a mustached Everyone is covered with pretzels. John has the pretzel b WILLIAMS (totally mortified)
Oh, Countess. I'm so sorry. The Countess has a pretzel wedged around her eye like a m her own monocle up to the other eye, trying to keep her d THE COUNTESS
Really! Sherry hurries over to help straighten things up. SHERRY (to guest with lid on his head)
Oh, John! Rumsford rushes in and joins the Stooges.  He sees the me RUMSFORD
Ooooh! Sherry starts to take the lid off John's head. SHERRY
I'll get you a drink. She removes the lid but his toupee comes off with it, lea ping pong ball.  He clutches his head in horror.  A distr confers with the Stooges.
RUMSFORD
Gentlemen, what will I do with her? Now, let me  tell you a little bit about Sherry. MOE
Oh, don't bother. I'll take Scotch. LARRY
Make mine rye. CURLY
I'll take gin smothered in bourbon. Nyuk, nyuk. MOE (to Larry and Curly)
Boys. Moe motions with eyes and head to something o.s.  They fo stare at each other for a split second before racing away over to a table loaded with drinks.  Sherry stands at the drink. SHERRY
Gentlemen, do have some rum punch. Sherry leaves with the drink and a tray of hors d'oeuvres CURLY
Rum punch? Why, soitanly. Nyuk, nyuk, nyuk,  nyuk, nyuk, nyuk. Curly removes his gloves. Larry pulls the stethoscope fro LARRY (off the stethoscope)
I knew this thing would come in handy. Larry removes the earpieces from the stethoscope, leaving tubing.  Moe watches as Larry offers one of the earpiece LARRY
Will you join me? The business end of the stethoscope is dropped into the b CURLY
Soitanly. Skoal. LARRY
Skoal. Using the tubing as a tandem drinking straw, Larry and Cu the rum punch.  After a moment, they stop and make faces. LARRY
This is weak. CURLY
Yeah. The rum went through this punch on  stilts. Moe takes a bottle from the table, opens it and takes a w MOE
This Scotch ought to help. LARRY (picking up another bottle)
This gin should make it fizzy. CURLY (with two bottles)
Bourbon and rum ought to help some. Curly sniffs one of the bottles.  He sneezes twice and is again when Sherry returns to the table and offers him a t SHERRY (to Curly)
Hors d'oeuvre? CURLY
No. Hay fever. Sherry busts out laughing at this and walks off.  The Sto various bottles into the punch bowl.  When these are empt some other bottles on the table. MOE
Hey, here's some new kind of liquor.  Wor-cester-shire!  (pours Worcestershire sauce into the punch bowl)
Oh, ho ho ho. LARRY
This says "Tabasco" -- I ain't never drunk any.  But we'll put it in.  MOE
What have you got to lose? Larry pours hot Tabasco sauce into the bowl.  Curly squea hands with delight as he finds a bottle of his own. CURLY

Nyuk, nyuk, nyuk.  Sham paynee! Curly POPS the cork on his champagne bottle.  The cork fl champagne SPRITZES out of the top.  Curly covers the bott stop the flow.  After a pause he looks over at Moe and do We SWISH PAN TO discover Moe with the champagne cork wedg Moe grimaces, pulls the cork from his eye, stares at it f down, and confronts Curly. MOE
You shouldn't handle dangerous weapons.  (off the champagne bottle)
Give me that. CURLY
I will not! MOE
Let me have it! CURLY (reluctantly)
Ohhh... Curly removes his hand and the foam SPRAYS Moe.  Curly di champagne into the punch bowl while Moe BOPS Curly's head succession.  Larry calls Moe's attention to the punch bow LARRY
Look!  It's boiling. The punch is practically steaming. CURLY

It must be done. The Stooges grab little glass cups and dip them into the their glasses together and all three drink simultaneously they wince horribly and belch PUFFS of smoke from their m down their glasses and wipe their mouths, looking rather LARRY
A marvelous accomplishment. MOE
A prodigious achievement. CURLY
You said it! It's putrid! Suddenly, Rumsford joins the Stooges at the table. RUMSFORD
Gentlemen, would you be good enough to look my  wife over now? MOE
A pleasure. RUMSFORD
This way. The Stooges follow Rumsford to the sofa where Sherry and talking. RUMSFORD (to Sherry)
The doctor's going to look you over, dear. SHERRY
Oh, goody. Curly joins Sherry and the Countess on the sofa, sitting and Larry stand nearby. MOE (to Sherry)
Now, uh, we shall test your reflex first. SHERRY
Okay, Doctor. CURLY

Nyuk, nyuk, nyuk, nyuk. Sherry's legs are crossed and Curly taps her just below t reflexes. But nothing happens.  Sherry just laughs. Curly frustration and taps her again.  Still nothing.  Curly sq face. CURLY

This is the way a normal reflex should act. To demonstrate, Curly crosses his own legs and taps himse Nothing.  He does a double take and scowls at Sherry.  No the Countess sitting beside him and taps her knee, still THE COUNTESS (offended, to Curly)
I beg your pardon. Delighted with Curly's boldness, Sherry gasps and puts a CURLY (to the Countess)
Oh, you don't have to apologize. You can't help  it you're crazy. The Countess is so shocked by this remark that the monocl eye. MOE (to Curly)

C'mere, guinea pig.  Curly rises, sits on the arm of the sofa, and crosses his beside him and prepares to show him how it's done. (Meanw other guests, including the Countess, start tapping thems knee.) MOE (professorially)
Now, then. Holding the palm at a forty-five  degree angle... Moe taps Curly below the knee.  Nothing happens.  MOE
Must be off a couple of degrees. Moe tries again.  Still nothing. MOE (upset, to Curly)
Trouble is, you've got no life. Moe KETTLE DRUMS Curly in the stomach.  Curly's leg lashe sending him backward.   MOE
Oh! Curly backs away, squealing, afraid of retaliation.  Reac of the room, Curly trips over the leg of a bookish guest reading a newspaper.  Curly falls to the floor. CURLY (to the guest)
Pardon me. GUEST

I'm sorry. The guest goes back to reading his paper and crosses his floor, Curly sees the guest's crossed legs and decides to knee. He hits it hard and makes a loud wooden THUMP.  The paper down and stares at Curly who squeals in frustration leg again. Finally, Curly smacks himself in the face a fe CHOPS the leg.  Curly clutches his hand in pain and HOWLS Curly an "it serves you right" nod.  The guest uncrosses BANGS loudly to the floor we realize it is a wooden leg. this, reaches down, and KNOCKS on the wood.  It sounds li at a door, so Curly says: CURLY

Come in. Curly pulls the guest's trouser leg up to reveal the actu tiny sign that reads: POST NO BILLS.  Curly rises and bac until he encounters a large white marble statue of a musc a pedestal.  Sort of a cut-rate version of Rodin's The Th the statue's bent leg and contemplates tapping its knee w CURLY

Ooo-oohh. Nyuk, nyuk, nyuk, nyuk. Curly taps the statue's knee and -- improbably -- obtains the statue's leg flexes.  In response, an amazed Curly ba the statue. Then pauses to wonder how the statue could ha is, of course, a male model made up to look like a statue Meanwhile, on the other side of the room, Moe, Larry and all bent over, tapping their legs below the knee.  Willia an announcement. WILLIAMS
Dinner is served. Moe straightens up and turns to Larry. MOE

Eats! Curly starts GIBBERING like a madman and running in place the sofa.  Larry runs around it and hops on Moe's back fo into the dining room. The guests and Williams watch all t looks while Sherry laughs happily. Finally, Curly runs ov Williams' back for his own piggy-back ride into the dinin SHERRY (laughing, to the stunned guests)
Aren't they marvelous?

Everyone save Williams is seated at the dining room table the head of the table.  On her right sits Moe and Larry ( flirt with the lady on his right, Moe grabs him violently Sherry's left sits Curly.  To Curly's left is the Countes the other end of the table, opposite Sherry.  The seating like this: Sherry
Moe                Curly Larry                The Countess Lady                Male Guest ?                Matronly Woman ?                John Rumsford
Everyone has a cream puff in front of them.  We know what CURLY (to Sherry)
I just love cream puffs. SHERRY
Oh, I hope you gentlemen will like my Spanish  dinner. CURLY
I'm just crazy about Spanish food -- especially  corned beef and cabbage. SHERRY (laughing, to guests)
Isn't he funny?  Ha ha ha! Curly notices the Countess looking around for something. CURLY
What's all the fuss? THE COUNTESS
I believe I dropped my serviette. CURLY
Well, just keep seated. Nobody'll notice it. The Countess gives him a look.  Curly shoots her a look r CURLY
Okay, have half of mine. Curly tears his napkin in half and hands it to the Counte THE COUNTESS (snootily)

Thenk you. Curly grins, waves and offers a quiet "Nyuk, nyuk."  Then Countess powdering her face with a powder puff.  He squea his pocket, and pulls out an electric razor.  He plugs in (apparently, the socket is built right into the dining ro starts to BUZZ loudly.  Curly starts shaving himself, muc annoyance.  He yelps when he snags a piece of skin just a he reaches over and starts shaving the Countess' face.  S in horror at this. THE COUNTESS
Really! She goes back to powdering her face.  Curly gives her one dismissive waves and goes back to shaving.  Williams appr with a tray. WILLIAMS
Biscuit, Madame? THE COUNTESS
No, thank you. Williams is about to offer Curly a biscuit but is shocked him shaving at the dinner table. WILLIAMS (disapproving)
Sir?! CURLY
Quiet! WILLIAMS (regains his composure)
Biscuit, sir? CURLY (rubbing his hands with glee)
Oh, soitanly! Curly takes a biscuit and sets to work on it with a knife grimaces in disbelief and moves on. William offers the tr WILLIAMS

Biscuit, sir? Moe and Larry manage to take their biscuits without incid two).  While Moe shakes enough salt onto his biscuit to p Columbia film library, Larry makes a sandwich out of his giant stalk of celery.  With both hands, Larry raises the to his mouth and is about to bite into it. MOE (to Larry)

Hey. Where's your Emily Post? Moe's reference to the famous etiquette maven causes Larr pinkies in the air before biting down joyfully on the san impolite CRUNCH.  Moe nods in approval and continues to s Meanwhile, the Countess continues powdering her face. Cur biscuit in two and places one half on the table and start other half. CURLY

This is my favorite dish. Biscuits! Biscuits  all the time. The Countess sets the powder puff down on top of Curly's finishes buttering, picks up the powder puff by mistake, "biscuit" in his mouth.   He tries to bite off a piece but can't.  He makes a face, Countess who now puts on lipstick, gives him a disdainful bites a piece of powder puff, glancing happily at the Cou chew it, going cross-eyed at the effort; swallows some do bite; squeals, earning another look from the Countess; Cu moment ... then abruptly stuffs the biscuit in his mouth another piece.   The Countess sighs and rolls her eyes. Suddenly, Curly st grabs his throat, eyes bulging.  Desperately, he WHACKS t causing face powder to SPEW out of his mouth.  He grabs a off the table and drinks some down.  He turns to look at grimaces.  The Countess is white with powder and totally cracks up at the sight of her. SHERRY (to Curly)
You funny, funny man! MOE (grimly ironic)
Yes. Isn't he a scream? Williams serves the tamales, a native Mexican food made o red peppers rolled in cornmeal and wrapped in corn husks. SHERRY
Ooh, I just love tamales in the Spring! CURLY (off his tamale)

What a funny thing. It don't know whether it's  comin' or goin'. Suspicious, Moe and Larry peer at their tamales, at first cautiously, then POUNDING them.  Curly picks his up, shak GLOOPY sound from its interior, sets it on his plate, and conversation with it. CURLY (to the tamale)
Speak to me so I'll know which is the head or  the tail. Curly barks at it twice, then pats it gently as if it wer CURLY (to the tamale)
Quiet now, quiet. Nyuk, nyuk. Moe tries to penetrate the corn husk with a spoon, to no MOE (to himself)
This thing can't lick me. Moe tucks his napkin into his collar and starts to manhan Meanwhile, Larry uses a fork and a knife on his tamale wi LARRY
Mmm. Stubborn, huh? Finally, Curly figures out that you have to unwrap the da happily begins to do so. CURLY
Nyuk, nyuk, nyuk, nyuk. Larry butters and salts his and BITES down on it as if it cob.  Moe tries to finger-poke his tamale as if it were C tries to squeeze the life out of it. MOE
Get tough with me-- ?! Moe SLAMS it to his plate. Sauce SQUIRTS out of it and bl He tries to wipe it off, only making it worse. MOE (off the tamale)

A bomb!  An infernal machine! Curly keeps tearing off flakes of husk, finally finding o starts to do the same.  Curly salts his husk and pops it butters one of his own, puts it with another one, and eat He claps his hands together and looks satisfied -- until Then, he pauses to make a face. Curly scrapes sauce off a and grows wild-eyed with anticipation as he salts the hus mouth with it.   Larry, having made no progress, bites into one end of his sauce to STREAM out the other end and blacken Curly's fac wipes his eye. Larry looks in horror at what he's done. CURLY (angry, to Larry)
Why, you--! Curly picks up a tamale and threatens to throw it at Larr LARRY
I'm sorry. Don't throw it!  Don't throw it!  Larry ducks his head into Moe's lap as Curly throws.  The spatters Moe.  Moe grabs Larry by the hair and pulls him MOE (to Larry)
Get up, you.  Moe SMACKS Larry on the forehead and turns to Curly. MOE (to Curly)
Why, you--! Moe picks up a cream puff to throw at Curly. CURLY
Moe!  Don't! Curly ducks his head into the Countess' lap as Moe throws hits the Countess in the forehead.  Curly pops up. CURLY

I ducked -- Curly sees the creamed Countess and reacts with horror. desperately tries to maintain an air of dignity. The youn beside her begins to roar with laughter at the sight of h him in his open mouth with a cream puff.  Now, it's Sherr hysterically.  The Male Guest grabs a cream puff and eyes rises, much to her dismay, preparing to hit her with it. THE COUNTESS (also rising)

Oh, no no no no no no... But, at the last second, he throws the cream puff at Sher her square in the face.  Rumsford, sitting at the far end to the guest named John, puts a hand to his head in disma smiling like a kid, winds up and pitches her cream puff a the table, hitting John. Then she grabs Curly's cream puf as he is shouting: RUMSFORD

This is outrageous!  I demand that something  be done-- ! Sherry laughs even harder than before, shaking in her cha open. Rumsford grabs a cream puff and somehow throws it r mouth.  John, wiping some cream from his face, accidental the Matronly Woman beside him.  She, in turn, picks up he SMACKS him with it.  They start throwing the rest of thei MOE (to Curly)
This is all your fault, you-- Moe picks up a cream puff.  Curly hides behind the Counte CURLY
Woo-woo-woo-woo-woo... Cut it out, Moe! A cream puff hits the Countess. She sputters. Curly pokes behind her. CURLY
Nyuk, nyuk, nyuk, nyuk. He ducks back. Another cream puff hits the Countess.  CURLY (to Moe)
You missed me. The Countess says something defiant but incomprehensible. MOE
